result.execSummary:
The defendant Cathy D. Ferrell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Psychological evaluation and follow through with treatment recommendations and/or medications
Participate an successfully complete any assessment, treatment or counseling as recommended by the risk assessment or as directed by the supervising agent, including AODA
Report any prescription medications to agent within 24 hours
Payment of all court ordered fees, supervision fees and restitution and maintain monthly payments

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other sentence in being

02:20 PM DA calls cases 16CF32, 16CF33, 18CF6, 18CF9, 18CF10 and 18CF13 Defendant Cathy D. Ferrell appeared with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA States Departments receipt and review of PSI. Court questions Atty Kirkpatrick of receipt and review of PSI. Atty Kirkpatrick acknowledges they have. Court gives DA and Atty Kirkpatrick letter from DE's pastor. Court acknowledges PSI and alternative PSI and reviewed also acknowledges letter from pastor. DA states not objections to departments PSI recommendations. Atty Kirkpatrick gives comments on the PSI and states DE has no been on probation. DA gives comments. DA gives Arguments/comments and sentencing recommendations. Arguments/Comments by Atty Kirkpatrick on sentencing recommendations. DE gives comments to the court. Court gives comments and proceeds to sentencing.  Parties argue jail credit from 16CF82 180 days, Court makes no decision on credit from that case.  Court fills on all cases the written explation of determination of sentence and voting rights filled out and copy given to DE in Court.

DE is given 11 days jail credit

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- Maintain Full time employment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Participate an successfully complete any assessment, treatment or counseling as recommended by the risk assessment or as directed by the supervising agent, including AODA
- Psychological evaluation and follow through with treatment recommendations and/or medications
- Report any prescription medications to agent within 24 hours
- Payment of all court ordered fees, supervision fees and restitution and maintain monthly payments
- Complete Victim Impact Group

DE not eligible for the Challenge incarceration program
DE is eligible for substance abuse program

Court advises DE of loss of rights as a convicted felon. 

Appeal Rights Given

DE taken into custody today, to Price County Jail today 06/24/2019.

Sentencing hearing on June 24, 2019 at 02:15 pm.

Sentencing hearing on April 24, 2019 at 02:00 pm.

09:15 AM DA calls cases 16CF32, 16CF33, 16CF82, 18CF6, 18CF9, 18CF10, 18CF13, 18CF15 Defendant Cathy D. Ferrell appeared with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement has been reached on all cases and motions to proceed to plea hearing. Court states Atty Kirkpatrick provided plea questionaire and waiver of rights on all cases. DA states facts on cases with additional elements stated. Court questions DE.  DA states arrainment has occurred on all cases. DA certifies Victim Rights Compliance.  Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Atty Kirkpatrick addresses court on status of DE health issues. Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on the following cases and counts. Pre Sentence Investigation is ordered by the court and completed within 6 weeks. Sentencing to be scheuled by beginning of April with JA. Bond to continue in all cases.


16CF32 Ct. 1   DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Ct. 1.

Counts 2-3 DRI for sentencing purposes.

18CF15 - Counts 1-7 dismisses but DRI for sentencing purposes.

1:54 pm - DA calls cases 16CF32, 16CF33, 16CF82, 18CF6, 18CF9, 18CF10, 18CF13, 18CF15 and states appearances. Defendant Cathy D. Ferrell in court with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is a motion to modify bond due to DE's health. DA has no objection to Motion. Statement by Atty Kirkpatrick.  Response by DA. DE comments regarding health conditions. Court orders a $2000 Cash bond along with a $20,000 Signature bond both with the added condition that the DE may not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior approval of the Court. One bond for all cases. DA questions Court about jury trial set in16CF33 October 3, moving it to #1 trial. So ordered. Adj 2:11 pm
Judgment entered in 16CF32 (one bond for both cases)(16CF33)

2:15 pm - DA calls cases 18CF6, 18CF9, 18CF10, 18CF13, 18CF15(Prel) and 16CF32, 16CF33, 16CF82 (STC) and states appearances.  Defendant Cathy D. Ferrell in court with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ON the 18CF cases Atty Kirkpatrick presents court with a waiver of preliminary exam.  Court questions DE regarding waiver.  Preliminary Hearing waived.  Waiver accepted by the Court.  Court finds probable cause exists and binds DE over for trial.  Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived.
Atty Kirkpatrick comments on the 16CF cases and DE asks for a speedy trial demand in case 16CF33.  To be set for trial.  The other 16 cases are to track along with 16CF33.  DA states that he would have a problem submitting a learned treatise 40 days before trial.  Scheduling to be worked out to allow state time for that.
Status conference on March 1, 2018 at 02:15 pm.

1:36 pm - Court calls cases 16CF32, 16CF33 and 16CF82 and DA states appearances.  Defendant Cathy D. Ferrell appeared with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  There are no motions filed.  Parties stipulate to the admissablity of statements.  Court agrees.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

10:03 am - Defendant Cathy D. Ferrell appeared, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls NEW case and states appearances and possible charges.  DE next court date is 2/27/18 at 10 am.  Court gives DE a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  DA states that there are 3 open cases for this DE, 16CF32, 16CF33 and 16CF83.  32 and 33 have a $2000 SB (one bond for both cases) and 82 has a $1500 CB.  DA asks that these bonds be forfeited.  So ordered.  Court orders new cash bond, one bond for all four cases.
Motion hearing on February 23, 2018 at 01:15 pm.

1:24 pm - DA calls cases 16CF32, 16CF33, and 16CF82 and states appearances.  Defendant Cathy D. Ferrell appeared with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE has not received discovery and is asking for adjournment.  To be set off.  Set for motion hearing within 45 days.  Bond to continue.
Motion hearing on December 28, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Atty Snyder presents court an order to withdraw.  Adj.  1:23 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 23, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
